aircraft.value: Nighthawk Stealth - AC-5371-151 at Regional Depot-B

defect_observed.value: Circuit breaker tripping under normal load. Abnormality observed during system test.

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Power Distribution component. Testing confirmed performance below acceptable limits.

corrective_action.value: Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation

preventive_action.value: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin

remarks_investigation.value: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.

remarks_design.value: Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings. Date: 03/03/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Eng. R.P. Singh

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing. Date: 05/03/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection. Date: 04/03/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions. Date: 07/03/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance. Date: 12/03/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Safety Critical
b) Defect Observed: Circuit breaker tripping under normal load. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Age-related degradation of elastomeric components
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Power Distribution component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
